image.altText: A photo of a beach with white sand and blue ocean with large boulders near the shore.

props.synopsis: The body of a diver, who went missing off Tasmania's east coast, was found by his brother, police say.

title.children: Body of missing diver at Bay of Fires found by brother, Tasmania Police say

image.altText: Smoke rises above bushland.

props.synopsis: As bushfires continue to rage in Victoria's west, Melbourne residents have been hit with power outages and major transport delays from severe thunderstorms.

title.children: Bushfire evacuations in Victoria's west, major train delays as storms batter Melbourne

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Western Freeway partly closed, diversions in place
Residents in Bellfield, Pomonal urged to take shelter

image.altText: A husky and puppy lying together on a bench.

props.synopsis: On February 13, 1954, a group of expeditioners set up camp in Antarctica. Seventy years on, their huskies are no longer there but Australia's presence at Mawson Station remains vital for scientific research on the frozen continent.

title.children: The huskies are long gone, but Mawson Station continues 70 years after it was set up in Antarctica

image.altText: Swimmers at Sydney's Coogee Beach 260124

props.synopsis: Clinicians, patient organisations and medical researchers are updating advice around sun exposure to explicitly recognise different skin types.

title.children: New sun safety advice has been developed for diverse skin types. Here's what it says

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands at speaks at a lecturn.

props.synopsis: The government releases its first Closing the Gap update since the failed Voice referendum, after earlier marking the 16th anniversary of the national apology. Follow live.

title.children: Closing the Gap report tabled on anniversary of Stolen Generations apology

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ABC has received 3,000 complaints since Israel-Gaza war began
Anderson faces Senate estimates, probed over Lattouf sacking
Coalition calls for guarantees over government plan for 3,000 remote jobs

image.altText: Morrison and Macron at a table in the garden.

props.synopsis: Scott Morrison reveals the covert diplomatic manoeuvres behind the biggest deal of his prime ministership and how he kept it a secret from the man who could torpedo it.

title.children: 'I don't think, I know': The story behind the infamous French sledge about Scott Morrison

image.altText: Drone photo of a high school by the sea.

props.synopsis: Across Tasmania, there are almost 10,000 known landslides, including at the site of a large high school in Hobart.

title.children: This high school is slowly 'sliding down the hill'. It's sitting on one of thousands of landslides

image.altText: Blond woman in a sparkly suit flexing her muscles

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift fans have reported having their Ticketek accounts hacked and concert tickets stolen right underneath their noses, just days before the pop star begins her Melbourne shows.

title.children: Australian Swifties have Ticketek accounts hacked and tickets stolen days out from Eras tour

image.altText: James Tsindos in his school uniform.

props.synopsis: James Tsindos, 17, was unaware the food he ordered from an online app contained nuts before he died from anaphylaxis, a Victorian coroner has heard.

title.children: Coroner to examine food delivery app regulations after teen dies from nut allergy

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson, smiling.

props.synopsis: Lisa Wilkinson tells the Federal Court she learned she was being sued for defamation by Bruce Lehrmann from a newspaper article, as she seeks legal costs from Network Ten to cover last year's 20-day trial.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson says she was 'left alone' by Network Ten to fight accusations of 'derailing' rape trial of Bruce Lehrmann

image.altText: A young white woman teaching a primary school class

props.synopsis: A reading revolution at a small, disadvantaged public school in regional Victoria could provide the blueprint for turning around alarming literacy rates in Australia's 10,000 primary schools.

title.children: As the 'reading wars' raged, this school made a teaching change. The results were profound

image.altText: Two women at the beach stand in front of a free standing diving board out at sea.

props.synopsis: Residents of Beauty Point in northern Tasmania rally to save their diving board, thought to be up to 90 years old, amid safety concerns about the ageing structure.

title.children: Affectionately known as 'the divo', could this historical diving board become a thing of the past?

image.altText: A young man in a suit with no tie grimaces as he sits, listening, in the house of representatives

props.synopsis: Labor and the Greens have dug their trenches in preparation for what looms as another lengthy battle in their housing war — this time over a scheme that would see the government co-purchase houses with low-income households.

title.children: Help to Buy looks like round two in the Labor-Greens housing wars. What's it about?

image.altText: A silhouette of a person in a hoodie over wetlands at sunset.

props.synopsis: Jade has lost four family members to suicide. She is one of hundreds of First Nations people grieving for loved ones as the rate at which Indigenous people taking their own lives continues to rise.

title.children: 'It is getting worse every year': Indigenous Australian suicide rates on the rise

image.altText: A group of people stand before desks covered in paper in large room, facing fowards. One person, Adila Hassim, faces the camera.

props.synopsis: When Adila Hassim represented South Africa in its ICJ case against Israel, she was struck by the overwhelming sense that the courtroom is not a place for women. She's one of many prominent voices now calling for change in the world's highest court.

title.children: In the International Court of Justice, which is hearing allegations of genocide against Israel, where are all the women?

image.altText: The ASX boards in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has started the day relatively flat following a mixed performance on Wall Street. Meanwhile, the price of bitcoin has surged to $US50,000 for the first time in two years. Follow live on the markets blog.

title.children: ASX flat, JB does it again, consumer confidence rebounds (sort of) and bitcoin jumps to $US50,000

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX closes lower led by drops in Strike Energy, Breville, James Hardie
Load shedding in place after 'significant power system event' in Victoria, AEMO says
AGL confirms Loy Yang offline, cause yet to be determined

image.altText: Two Australian navy ships move alongside one another in the ocean

props.synopsis: Australia's Defence Force told the United States two years ago it was unable to help establish a new military task force in the Red Sea region because resources were needed at home and in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: Morrison government rejected US request for Red Sea military support just before 2022 election

image.altText: Morgan Riddle holds her thumb and index finger close together while in the crowd at Taylor Fritz's Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Morgan Riddle says she suffered a panic attack after being harassed at the Super Bowl, crystallising troubling findings from multiple studies around the world about sexual and domestic violence around sporting events.

title.children: Morgan Riddle's 'incessant' and 'scary' harassment at the Super Bowl backs up what we've known for years

image.altText: Travis Kelce

props.synopsis: Kansas City star Travis Kelce addresses his first-half tirade at coach Andy Reid as the Chiefs celebrate their Super Bowl victory.

title.children: 'You guys saw that?': Kelce addresses tirade at coach as Chiefs party after historic victory

image.altText: Kelvin Kiptum smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Kelvin Kiptum is being remembered as a "generational talent" who "had a whole life ahead of him to achieve incredible greatness".

title.children: 'Once-in-a-generation athlete': Tributes flow for 'Bolt-esque' marathon runner Kiptum after tragic death

image.altText: A woman with black hair and wearing a mask and jumper holds her fist in the air surrounded by a crowd of protesters.

props.synopsis: The Myanmar junta's decision to begin enforcing a conscription law first enacted 14 years ago is an attack on the country's young people, a "pronouncement of psychotic resolve" and likely to have unintended consequences, analysts say.

title.children: Myanmar's move to enforce military conscription to have 'unintended consequences'

image.altText: Woman on computer, generic

props.synopsis: YouTuber and host of Feminism Debunked Glenn Logan fails to convince a court he should not face contempt proceedings after he broadcast slabs of Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case.

title.children: YouTuber to face contempt proceedings after broadcasting Bruce Lehrmann defamation hearing

image.altText: A sign on a school announcing a closure due to fire dange

props.synopsis: Fires are burning in and around the Grampians National Park in Victoria's west, a region authorities warn is facing a "catastrophic" fire danger risk due to gusting winds and soaring temperatures.

title.children: Wimmera fires sparked as Victoria's west faces day of 'catastrophic' risk

image.altText: Commander of the Ukrainian army, Col. Gen. Oleksandr Syrskyi, gives instructions in a shelter in Soledar.

props.synopsis: The success of Ukraine's new military commander-in-chief depends on a good relationship with his president, a supportive Ukrainian parliament, military assistance from the West and political objectives aligning with military realities. It is a daunting predicament, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Ukraine's new military chief faces gargantuan challenges

image.altText: An artist's impression of a 5-storey apartment block on the corner of an intersection.

props.synopsis: Millennials moving to regional towns are part of a "societal shift" and they're not interested in buying big blocks with big backyards. But they do need to live somewhere.

title.children: How high is too high? Small towns fear multi-storey apartment blocks will change them forever

image.altText: Member for Namatjira Chansey Paech in NT Parliament on Wednesday May 3, 2017.

props.synopsis: Deputy Chief Minister Chansey Paech says he did nothing wrong by purchasing shares, which he has since sold, in a major wholesaler which supplies alcohol to Central Australian bottle shops while also advocating against replacing federal Intervention-era alcohol bans in the region.

title.children: NT deputy chief minister defends ownership of shares in major alcohol wholesale company

image.altText: Close up of a woman's hands who is typing on a laptop in bed, working after hours.

props.synopsis: For some workers, the 'right to disconnect' laws could be a welcome permission slip to create balance between work and home. As a freelancer, I've already started experimenting with how I can do this with email.

title.children: 'I'm not an email machine': Needing work-life balance, I tried these six things

image.altText: Bowl of overnight oats with chia seeds, topped with berries, an easy breakfast recipe.

props.synopsis: From smoothies to overnight oats, here are three breakfast ideas to make your morning easier.

title.children: Three easy breakfast ideas to get you out the door on time

image.altText: An up-close photo of a box of chocolates with a red heart in the centre.

props.synopsis: Gifting chocolates on Valentine's Day is a time-honoured tradition, but this year's record high prices could put a damper on the romance. Here's why your favourite treat is costing more than before — and what you can do to help fix the problem.

title.children: The bittersweet reason chocolate prices are at a record high this Valentine's Day

image.altText: A man and woman stand outside the Sara Lee factory.

props.synopsis: Klark and Brooke Quinn, who previously steered prominent Australian brand Darrell Lea through administration, say they are in for the long term at beleaguered dessert maker, Sara Lee.

title.children: New Sara Lee owners look forward to bright future, saving jobs

image.altText: Pat Carrigan drinks a beer while sitting alongside Brisbane Broncos Adam Reynolds at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Adam Reynolds and Pat Carrigan say they should not have put themselves in a position where they were filmed getting into a push and shove in a Brisbane park after a night out.

title.children: 'A playful fight that got a little bit heated': Broncos stars 'embarrassed' by footage of drunken scuffle in park

image.altText: A police vehicle blocks a dirt road with SES volunteers wearing orange in the background.

props.synopsis: A call to "let police do their job" comes following the closure of a Facebook group set up to coordinate search efforts for the missing mum after it became a haven for theories and speculation.

title.children: Speculation about Samantha Murphy's disappearance unhelpful as police sift through information, former detective says

image.altText: Five Burarra women in shirts and long skirts stand together on a beach in the afternoon sun.

props.synopsis: The NGV commissioned 25 new artworks for its Triennial, including an epic one-of-a-kind weaving from a remote Top End community determined to keep its traditions alive through art.

title.children: Thirteen women, two years and 35,000 threads: How Australia's largest woven sculpture was made
